intro: Anomalosicyos palmatilobus, commonly known as the broad-lobed cholla, is a rare and unique cactus native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its thick, ribbed stems that are covered in clusters of spines and glochids, which provide protection from herbivores. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a striking contrast to its rugged appearance. Its leaves are modified into spines, and it stores water in its fleshy stems to survive in harsh desert conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
